channel.title: videos on Zero to ASIC
channel.description: Recent content in videos on Zero to ASIC

item.title: Interview With Sylvain 'tnt' Munaut: USB peripherals
item.description: In this interview I talk with Sylvain ‘tnt’ Munaut about his Google/Skywater ASIC application. The design is especially interesting to me because of the way it merges the SRAM blocks with the logic. This has been a major challenge in my own design. Here’s the link to the repository

item.title: Hackaday #remoticon talk
item.description: I recently presented a demo/presentation for Hackaday’s #remoticon. talk on twitch slides from the talk presentation tools

item.title: Inverter
item.description: A standard cell is a building block that contains some basic digital or analogue functionality. These blocks are then tiled together to make the final design. Since finding out about the Skywater PDK, I wanted to try drawing my own ‘standard cell’ using the Skywater transistor models. An inverter is one of the simplest and even that was quite difficult! As you can see below it contains an N and P type MOSFET.
